channel.title: math.CV updates on arXiv.org
channel.description: math.CV updates on the arXiv.org e-print archive.

item.title: $L^2$ extension of holomorphic functions and log canonical places
item.description: arXiv:2505.00801v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: In an influential $L^2$ extension theorem due to Demailly, the finiteness of an $L^2$ norm called the Ohsawa norm determines whether a given holomorphic function can be extended. This result has been further generalized by Zhou and Zhu to the case when the quasi-plurisubharmonic defining function of the subvariety has non-analytic singularities. We show that, however, there exist many instances of such defining functions for which only the zero function has finite Ohsawa norm, so that the $L^2$ extension statement is void in such cases, even when it has a unique log canonical place. Such a defining function occurs already among some of the simplest non-analytic singularities, namely toric ones.
item.dc:creator: Dano Kim, Xu Wang

item.title: Determinantal representations in umbral calculus
item.description: arXiv:2505.01274v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: In this paper, we construct a duality functor for affine rational curves given by polynomials in echelon form. This provides an explicit way to realize dual bases for the classical polarity pairing, and also yields known results on determinantal representations of Appell sequences of polynomials. We also provide a finite-difference version of these constructions, that allows to build approximate polarity pairings as well as a corresponding Grace theorem with a controlled optimal error term.
item.dc:creator: Julien Grivaux

item.title: Classification of Principle 3D Slices of Filled-in Julia Sets in Multicomplex Spaces
item.description: arXiv:2505.00957v1 Announce Type: cross Abstract: A generalization of the filled-in Julia set is presented using the multicomplex numbers and an algorithm is presented to visualize these sets in the tridimensional space. There are many ways to visualize these higher dimensional fractals sets on a computer. We therefore introduce an equivalence relation between 3D representations and show that, for the filled-in Julia sets associated to the polynomial $z^p + c$, there are nine 3D slices when $p$ is an odd integer and four when $p$ is even. These results differs from the recent characterization obtained by Brouillette and Rochon in 2019 and the proofs require different arguments in the context of the filled-in Julia sets.
item.dc:creator: Quentin Charles, Pierre-Olivier Paris\'e

item.title: WITHDRAWN: A proof of the Krzyz conjecture
item.description: arXiv:2504.10223v3 Announce Type: replace Abstract: WITHDRAWN: The proof contains an uncorrectable gap in the proof of theorem 7 on page 11. A proof of the Krzyz conjecture is presented, based on the application of the variational method, as well as on the use of two classical results and some of their consequences. The mentioned results are the Caratheodory-Toeplitz criterion of continuing a polynomial to a Caratheodory class function, and the Riesz-Fejer theorem about trigonometric polynomials. This is an English translation of a preprint originally published in Russian: https://preprints.ru/article/1799
item.dc:creator: Denis Stupin

item.title: Unique continuation for a gradient inequality with $L^n$ potential
item.description: arXiv:2402.15503v2 Announce Type: replace-cross Abstract: We establish a unique continuation property for solutions of the differential inequality $|\nabla u|\leq V|u|$, where $V$ is locally $L^n$ integrable on a domain in $\mathbb R^n$. A stronger uniqueness result is obtained if in addition the solutions are locally Lipschitz. One application is a finite order vanishing property in the $L^2$ sense for the exponential of $W^{1,n}$ functions. We further discuss related results for the Cauchy-Riemann operator $\bar\partial$ and characterize the vanishing order for smooth extension of holomorphic functions across the boundary.
item.dc:creator: Adam Coffman, Yifei Pan, Yuan Zhang
